news.title: Ghaziabad development body starts land acquisition for Harnandipuram
news.para: GDA vice chairperson Atul Vats told TOI, "Land acquisition for any project can be tricky, and for its Harnandipuram township project, GDA needs to acquire 336 hectares from five villages."

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government issues guidelines for land pooling scheme-II, retains LPS-I norms
news.para: The government has already conducted grama sabhas in Tadikonda and Pedakurapadu constituencies to implement LPS-II and has set the groundwork for the formal launch of the scheme.

news.title: Nashik civic body to set up urban design cell to enhance city planning
news.para: It will focus on various aspects of urban development such as mapping infrastructure, promoting walkability and developing plans for making better places in the city.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh cabinet to notify revised building bylaws easing vertical development
news.para: The new rules and guidelines would give property owners the opportunity to create more usable space on a piece of land. Officials said more than 1,000 objections and suggestions were disposed of, and some were considered before preparing the final draft.

news.title: Pune civic body starts disconnecting water connections to dilapidated wadas
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has identified 37 such properties for the action and sought assistance from police in the compulsory evacuation of the residents. Letters have also been sent to Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd (MSEDCL) regarding connections to such wadas, a senior PMC official said.

news.title: Four Gurgaon builders fined for illegal groundwater extraction, borewells sealed
news.para: Borewells and sump wells at these project sites, which are located in sectors 102, 103 and 37D, were also sealed, stated an inquiry report filed by HWRA chairperson Keshni Anand Arora to NGT.

news.title: IL&FS seeks to disqualify Brookfield Co from buying its finance centre
news.para: IL&FS has filed a plea seeking to reverse the sale of its iconic BKC building to Brookfield, alleging non-compliance with bid conditions. The insolvent financier claims Brookfield's unit, Chronos, failed to renew a ₹108-crore performance guarantee, rendering the letter of intent invalid. This move comes as commercial property values in BKC have risen, potentially making Brookfield's initial offer less appealing.

news.title: Delayed e-Khatas stall property work in Bengaluru
news.para: Adding to the challenges, over five lakh properties in Bengaluru still lack any official BBMP Khata, yet transactions continue through sub-registrar offices. Although 24,000 owners have applied for new e-Khatas, the process remains slow due to detailed document verification.

news.title: Tamil Nadu government unveils ‘deemed NOC’ system for planning permits
news.para: Under the new framework, 11 key departments — including district collectorates, fire services, water resources, forest, CMRL, TNHB — must process NOC requests within 30 days, with the exception of the department of agriculture, which has a 21-day deadline.

news.title: Lucknow development body not to hike sector rates of its properties
news.para: As a result, the proposed hike in district magistrate circle rates will not affect the prices of those LDA properties that are evaluated based on reserved sector rates.

news.title: Chandigarh administration demolishes 10 residential structures in Manimajra
news.para: The land, measuring approximately 38 acres, was acquired by the administration in 1998 for public purposes, and compensation was duly paid. However, over the years, nearly 1.5 acres of this land were illegally encroached upon, with unauthorised structures built.

news.title: Vadodara: 15 years later, Akota slum residents keep promise and vacate plot voluntarily
news.para: The residents had originally belonged to Pir Vasahat, a slum settlement in Akota, which the VMC sought to vacate in 2010 to make way for the Akota-Dandia Bazaar Road development project.

news.title: NGT issues notice to Delhi Jal Board over illegal borewells
news.para: Tomar alleged that 19 private builders had dug illegal borewells across Delhi. NGT bench, led by Justice Prakash Shrivastava, noted that the allegations require verification through a spot inspection by the DJB.

news.title: Over 75% of tenement holders in Dharavi qualify for new homes
news.para: All bona fide residents who settled in Dharavi before January 1, 2000, are eligible for a 350 sq ft flat within Dharavi. All such residents will qualify for the resettlement unless they do not provide documents.

news.title: SC allows M3M Group's plea for substitution of provisionally attached property
news.para: A bench of Justices P S Narasimha and R Mahadevan, however, said the substitution of the property would be subject to nine conditions as suggested by ED.

news.title: Gurugram's illegal concrete plants to face sealing, power shutdown: Commerce minister
news.para: While speaking at a review meeting held with officials of the DHBVN and pollution control board on Tuesday regarding departmental works in the district, action on illegal activities, and strengthening of infrastructure, Singh said,

news.title: Lodha Developers to deposit ₹520 crore as security in legal case against V Hotels
news.para: Lodha Developers Ltd informed that this matter is related to proceedings initiated by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against the erstwhile promoter of V Hotels Ltd (VHL). This was in relation to a transaction of Rs 520.80 crore, allegedly routed through VHL before the start of the insolvency process.

news.title: New World Development shares jump after closing $11.2 billion refinancing deal
news.para: New World's shares soared around 8% in morning trade, compared to the broader market's 0.7% rise. They resumed trading after a holiday in Hong Kong on Tuesday and provided the first stock market reaction since the successful refinancing was announced late on Monday.

news.title: Sudhanshu Infrastructure booked for illegal construction, assault in Bhandup redevelopment case
news.para: The Slum Rehabilitation Authority (SRA) has filed a police complaint against Sudhanshu Infrastructure and Abhayjit Dubey for unauthorized construction and occupancy violations at Aniraj Tower in Bhandup. The developer allegedly constructed an illegal hall, handed over commercial units without approvals, and defied repeated notices. Following complaints, Dubey and an associate also face charges for assaulting a society member.

news.title: Maharashtra government to crackdown on illegal sand mining in Wardha river
news.para: Bawankule said the state introduced a new sand policy on April 1, abolishing the earlier depot system and replacing it with an auction-based model, which has already begun generating healthy revenue.
